greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sixth convolution of A115140.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1669
formula: O.g.f.: 1/c(x)^6 = P(7, x) - x*P(6, x)*c(x) with the o.g.f. c(x):=(1-sqrt(1-4*x))/(2*x) of A000108 (Catalan numbers) and the polynomials P(n, x) defined in A115139. Here P(7, x)=1-5*x+6*x^2-x^3 and P(6, x) = 1-4*x+3*x^2.

a(n) = -C6(n-6), n>=6, with C6(n) = A003517(n+2) (sixth convolution of Catalan numbers). a(0)=1, a(1)=-6, a(2)=9, a(3)=-2, a(4)=0=a(5). [1, -6, 9, -2] is row n=6 of signed A034807 (signed Lucas polynomials). See A115149 and A034807 for comments.
program: (MAGMA) m:=30; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Rationals(), m); Coefficients(R!( (1-6*x+9*x^2-2*x^3 +(1-4*x+3*x^2)*Sqrt(1-4*x))/2 )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 12 2019
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 13 2006
